summary: Continuous deployments over the past 2 decades have reduced the Air Force's readiness—affecting personnel, equipment, and aircraft. To rebuild readiness, the Air Force is implementing a new process to organize, deploy, and train forces. But this process has challenges. For example, the Air Force plans to eventually deploy an entire wing from an airbase rather than individuals from multiple wings and airbases. But it hasn't...
title: Air Force Readiness: Actions Needed to Improve New Process for Preparing Units to Deploy
